meanings.definition: Not aware or conscious of something.
meanings.sent1: She walked through the room unware of the spider hanging from the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The child was unware of the danger lurking in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: He was unware of the surprise party planned for his birthday.
meanings.sent4: The thief moved unware through the house, stealing valuables without a sound.
meanings.sent5: The hiker, unware of the approaching storm, continued along the trail.

meanings.definition: Lacking knowledge or information about something.
meanings.sent1: The student was unware of the upcoming test and didn't study.
meanings.sent2: She remained unware of the changes happening in the company.
meanings.sent3: The detective was unware of the crucial clue right in front of him.
meanings.sent4: The explorer, unware of the map's error, ventured into the wrong territory.
meanings.sent5: The scientist, unware of the new research findings, presented outdated information at the conference.
